title: Shargeek 170: 140W power bank arrives on Amazon with time-sensitive discount
text: Following AOHi's success with the Starship's crowdfunding campaign, rival fast-charging accessory brand Sharge has hit back by announcing that the "wait is over" for those who would prefer to buy the Shargeek 170 via online retail channels rather than crowdfunding websites. It has a typical capacity of 24,000mAh, compared to 40,000mAh for the AOHi Starship; then again, Sharge has outfitted its "futuristic" power bank with a larger and more colorful Smart Display to keep track of how fast it is charging and how much it has left in its transparent housing. It also comes with a 240W cable in the box. The OEM indicated that it would list the uniquely "prismatic" power bank at a full price of ~$198; however, the Shargeek 170 (so called as it is rated to deliver up to 140W of charge via either of its dual USB-C ports and 30W via an additional single type-A port) has been released at $149 (or €138.27) for a limited time. The 170 is also now listed on Amazon, and may have the same deal when its page goes live, provided it does so before March 4, 2024 at 04:59 AM CET (or 23:59 PST). Disclaimer: Notebookcheck is not responsible for price changes carried out by retailers. The discounted price or deal mentioned in this item was available at the time of writing and may be subject to time restrictions and/or limited unit availability. Sharge
